asset.name: zidesamtinib
asset.one_liner: Best-in-class ROS1 inhibitor with TRK-sparing selectivity for improved safety and broad mutation coverage

target.name: ROS1
target.pathway: ROS1 fusion → constitutive kinase activation → tumor growth

biology.simple_explanation: ROS1 is a receptor tyrosine kinase that when fused to various partner genes creates oncogenic fusion proteins driving tumor growth. ROS1 fusions occur in 1-3% of NSCLC patients, typically younger never-smokers.
biology.cns_involvement: 20-40% present with brain metastases; 30-55% develop brain mets at 1L progression

why_good_target.clinical_validation: Multiple approved ROS1 TKIs (crizotinib, entrectinib, repotrectinib, taletrectinib) validate the target
unmet_need: No approved therapy active after dual TRK/ROS1 inhibitors (repotrectinib, taletrectinib)
Treatment-limiting CNS adverse events with current TRK/ROS1 inhibitors
Limited durability - crizotinib mPFS only 19.3 months vs lorlatinib mPFS not reached in ALK

lead.name: ROS1+ NSCLC (TKI pre-treated)
lead.rationale: Patients progressing on prior ROS1 TKIs have limited options; zidesamtinib active against resistance mutations

expansion.name: ROS1+ NSCLC (TKI-naïve)
expansion.rationale: Potential for best-in-class 1L therapy based on early data

pivotal_safety.description: ROS1+ NSCLC treated at RP2D as of March 21, 2025

tki_pretreated_efficacy.description: Treated at RP2D by May 31, 2024 to allow ≥6 months DOR follow-up

safety.key_differentiator: TRK-sparing design avoids CNS toxicity seen with TRK inhibitors

trk_sparing.clinical_relevance: Avoids dizziness, ataxia, cognitive effects associated with TRK inhibition

mutation_coverage.other_mutations: Sub-10 nM across S1986F, F2004C/V, L2026M, D2033N

cns_penetration.clinical_evidence: 48-85% intracranial ORR depending on prior therapy

catalysts.what_to_watch: FDA approval decision for ROS1+ NSCLC
Durability of 89% ORR in frontline setting

approved_ros1_tkis.limitation: Limited mutation coverage, modest CNS activity

zidesamtinib_advantages: 670x ROS1 vs TRKB selectivity (vs 1.4-7.7x for competitors)

investment_analysis.probability_of_success: High - NDA filed based on strong pivotal data

market_opportunity.pricing_assumption: Similar to other targeted oncology TKIs
